result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicolas Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have any contact with SMP, JJP, JAM, RRA, MNP, IMP, NEP, NAP or their residences.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall comply with all orders of the injunction in Case 21CV561.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith, with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicolas Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Nicolas Garcia. Victim present.  NGI report has been received that does not support special plea; State and def do not object to findings.  Case is resolved w/def free to argue.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4, Ct 5; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1. Statements from victim.  Argument from State and counsel.  Atty Hoff reads statement from def. 
 Court proceeds to sentencing.
